title.bibl: Dziennik Zwiazkowy, Aug. 7, 1917. Polish Dentist Begins Practice

notesStmt.note: Transcribed from digital images contributed to the Internet Archive by the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

div.bibl: Dziennik Zwiazkowy, Aug. 7, 1917. POLISH DENTIST BEGINS PRACTICE

body.p: Dr. Wenceslaus Strozewski was born in the Kingdom in Poland [Russian occupation], where he received his elementary education. He came to the United States at a very early age and, at first, attended evening school. Later, he entered the high school at Valparaiso, Indiana, upon graduation from which he attended Valparaiso University.
In 1914, he enrolled with the Chicago College of Dental Surgery. After three years of study, he received his degree in dental surgery at the commencement exercises held at the Garrick Theater.
Dr. Strozewski has already received notification from Springfield that he has passed the state examination, which gives him the right to practice dentistry and dental surgery.

Dr. Strozewski is a member of the Polish National Alliance: Polish Eagle
Society, group 523.
He plans to conduct his practice in the city of Chicago.
